Question_1.Context: Details about the chemical composition of essential oils extracted from fennel seeds and Micromeria fruticose leaves.
Question_1.Question: Which compound accounted for the highest percentage in the essential oil of fennel seeds?
Question_1.Source: Trans‑anethole accounted for the highest percentage (93.69%) in the essential oil of fennel seeds.

Question_2.Context: Details about the chemical components of the essential oil extracted from fennel seeds.
Question_2.Question: Which compound accounted for the highest percentage in the essential oil of fennel seeds?
Question_2.Source: Trans‑anethole accounted for the highest percentage (93.69%) in the essential oil of fennel seeds.

Question_3.Context: Information about the impact of Fe-EO and Thy-EO on melanoma cell growth.
Question_3.Question: At what concentration did Mix-EO suppress B16F10 or A431 cell growth by approximately 75% compared to carrier treatment?
Question_3.Source: Mix-EO at a concentration of 25 μg/ml suppressed B16F10 or A431 cell growth by approximately 75% compared to carrier treatment.

Question_4.Context: Details about the effects of Fe-EO, Thy-EO, and Mix-EO on MMP9 expression.
Question_4.Question: Which treatment resulted in the best suppression of MMP9 expression in tumors compared to control?
Question_4.Source: MMP9 expression was best suppressed after Mix-EO treatment compared to control by qPCR.

Question_5.Context: Information about the impact of Mix-EO on tumor-associated mesenchymal stem cells.
Question_5.Question: How did all tested EOs affect MMP9 expression in tumor-associated mesenchymal stem cells?
Question_5.Source: All tested EOs completely suppressed MMP9 expression in tumor-associated mesenchymal stem cells.

Question_6.Context: Details about the impact of Mix-EO on tumor growth and MMP9 expression.
Question_6.Question: What was the effect of Mix-EO treatment on tumor growth compared to control?
Question_6.Source: Mix-EO treatment reduced tumor growth compared to control in the B16F10 subcutaneous melanoma model.

Question_7.Context: Information about the impact of Fe-EO and Thy-EO on NFkB signaling.
Question_7.Question: Which signaling pathway was suppressed by Fe-EO and Thy-EO in melanoma cells?
Question_7.Source: Fe-EO and Thy-EO inhibited NFkB signaling in melanoma cells.

Question_8.Context: Details about the proposed mode of action of Fe-EO and Thy-EO.
Question_8.Question: What was the proposed mechanism of action of Fe-EO and Thy-EO in inhibiting tumor growth and migration?
Question_8.Source: Fe-EO and Thy-EO suppressed tumor growth and migration by inhibiting NFkB and MMP9 expression.

Question_9.Context: Information about the effects of Mix-EO on stromal cell-derived factors.
Question_9.Question: What was the effect of Mix-EO treatment on MMP9 expression in tumor-associated mesenchymal stem cells compared to bone marrow-derived MSCs?
Question_9.Source: Mix-EO treatment inhibited MMP9 expression in tumor-associated mesenchymal stem cells compared to bone marrow-derived MSCs.

Question_10.Context: Details about the impact of Mix-EO on tumor growth and MMP9 expression.
Question_10.Question: What was the effect of Mix-EO treatment on MMP9 expression in tumors compared to control?
Question_10.Source: Mix-EO treatment suppressed MMP9 expression in tumors compared to control.
